sense.name: send back (money owed)
sense.examples: Departments must maintain records to show that they collected and remitted the proper amount of tax on their sales transactions. Winter Harbor remitted the premium for the two policies to Ms. Rulman. They had already paid themselves, and remitted the balance.

sense.name: revoke (debt, claims, penalties)
sense.examples: The President has, however, remitted the sentence in view of the recommendation of the court. Our Lord forgive us our evil deeds and remit our sins. Her advocate not only remitted his costs, but paid her fare home.

sense.name: lessen in intensity; abate
sense.examples: All schizophrenic symptoms remitted completely in six out of 14 adults. The Graves' disease remitted immediately after BMT but relapsed 18 months later.

sense.name: refer (a matter or legal case) back to another authority
sense.examples: Seshasayana Reddy remitted the case to the PCB saying that certain reports from technical bodies had not been considered. Ukraine Supreme Arbitration Tribunal set aside those decisions and remitted the case to the Kiev Region Arbitration Tribunal. He remitted the proceedings back to the Office to consider the application for permission to amend the patent.
